value.title: Remove Digits or Keep them in Power BI Using Power Query
value.excerpt: There are a couple of useful actions that help a lot in cleaning data; removing digits, or keeping digits and removing everything else. In this short video, I’ll explain a simple method to do that using Power Query. Codes are in my blog article here: https://radacad.com/remove-digits-or-keep-them-in-power-bi-using-power-query
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/pZVS3O-4Jb4" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Removing the Total Value for a Column in the Table Visual of Power BI Using ISFILTERED
value.excerpt: Table visual is one of the most commonly used visuals. In Power BI, you can turn off the total row (when it won’t make sense to have the total) entirely. However, you cannot turn off the total for some columns and keep it working for the others. Using a DAX function, you can, however, do this easily.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/TP82dLISmgo" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Share Different Visual Pages with Different Security Groups in Power BI
value.excerpt: I have written a dozen of blogs and a book about Power BI row-level security and the security on the dataset. However, I always get this question that: "What if I want some people to see only a few pages of my report, and some others to see other pages?" or "How can I put security for different pages
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Iy1ZjToy-B8" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: SUM vs SUMX What is the Difference of the two DAX Functions in Power BI
value.excerpt: Sum and Sumx are functions that often founded to be misleading for many Power BI users. As both functions are doing the aggregation, it seems a bit confusing what is the actual difference between these two. There are many blog posts and articles about each function. I always explain the difference with
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/-3snD-VOqik" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Apply AND Logic to Multiple Selection in DAX Slicer
value.excerpt: When you apply a multiple selection to a slicer or to a filter, you obtain a logical OR condition between selected items. This video shows how to implement a logical AND condition in a measure instead of the standard OR one. Article and download: https://sql.bi/26121?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/tONOosN1xAs" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: CALCULATE in DAX #08: Add filters using IN
value.excerpt: Use the IN operator in CALCULATE filters. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt CALCULATE function: https://dax.guide/calculate/?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/4-WSXQ6qLec" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Create Static Tables in DAX Using the DATATABLE Function
value.excerpt: The DATATABLE function can create static tables in a Power BI model specifying column names and data types. Article and download: https://sql.bi/27271/?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Distinguishing HASONEVALUE from ISINSCOPE
value.excerpt: This video describes the differences between HASONEVALUE and ISINSCOPE, which are two useful DAX functions to control the filters and the grouping that are active in a report. Article and download: https://sql.bi/662962?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/8UNNo233eFc" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Filtering a measure in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: DAX Studio can evaluate one or more measures in a query. Marco Russo shows how to apply filters to a measure executed in DAX Studio. Continuous learning to improve your productivity!  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ZIJDv3J9kko" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: How to debug a DAX measure
value.excerpt: Use DAX Studio to run and debug a DAX measure: fix a calculation issue in a more productive environment and then copy the right formula back in Power BI. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/ VertiPaq Analyzer: https://www.sqlbi.com/tools/vertipaq-analyzer/

value.title: Becoming a solution architect for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
value.excerpt: Learn how to become a solution architect.

value.title: Build systems of insights for enterprise scale with Power BI and Azure
value.excerpt: Build systems of insights for enterprise scale with Power BI and Azure

value.title: Write DAX formulas for Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to write DAX formulas to create calculated tables, calculated columns, and measures, which are different types of model calculations. Additionally, you'll learn how to write and format DAX formulas, which consist of expressions that use functions, operators, references to model objects, constants, and variables.

value.title: Discover customer needs as a Solution Architect for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
value.excerpt: Learn how to ask customers questions about their business processes and feature requirements to create a viable solution.

value.title: Power Platform - Introduction, business value, and demos
value.excerpt: Explore the capabilities of Power Platform applications, as seen in demonstrations and customer case studies.

value.title: Propose a solution as a Solution Architect for Power Platform and Dynamics 365
value.excerpt: Learn how to propose a solution.

value.title: Calculate Totals for  MTD, QTD and YTD in DAX
value.excerpt: Learn how to quickly use the CALCULATE function to get total from year to date, month to date and quarter to date in Power BI using a Calendar table and time intelligence functions in DAX.

value.title: Change The Font  Across All Visuals in a Power BI

value.title: Create a Power BI Dashboard in 10 Minutes!
value.excerpt: Enjoy my free full course on Udemy https://www.udemy.com/share/102Qqu/ Learn how to quickly create your first dashboard using Microsoft Power BI fast. This tutorial will teach you how to load, transform and visualize data with ease.  Contact me on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/gaelimholland

value.title: Cumulative Distribution Plot in Power BI
value.excerpt: Learn how to create cumulative distribution plot which is a great alternative to a histogram. Histogram can lead to binning bias that will provide different distribution of the same data.

value.title: How to Use CALCULATE in Power BI
value.excerpt: This is one of the most import function to master in Power BI. You can filter your data and create complex measure such as year over year comparisons with ease with these easy to follow tutorial. More more help this function.

value.title: 17 ways 🙈 to copy and paste in Power BI
value.excerpt: In today's video I am going to show you 17 ways (!!) to copy and paste in Power BI. Did you know all of them? Did I forget any?
